bioghist.p: O. Theodor (Ted) Benfey (b. 1925) is Emeritus Professor of Chemistry and History of Science, Guilford College, and Editor-at-Large of Chemical Heritage newsmagazine. In 1966, he was chair of the American Chemical Society Division of the History of Chemistry. From 1963-1988 he was Editor of the ACS chemical education journal Chemistry. Benfey is the author of many publications, including Classics in the Theory of Chemical Combination (Dover, 1963), Kekul√© Centennial (ACS, 1966), and Introduction to Organic Reaction Mechanisms (McGraw-Hill, 1970).

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a selection of Benfey's academic and professional papers. Materials include: notes from lectures that Benfey attended while on sabbatical at Harvard from 1955-1956 (Frank Westheimer on Physical Organic Chemistry and Peter Debye on Chemical Physics, among others); photostats of French, German, and English articles on chemistry used by Benfey for his book Classics in the Theory of Chemical Combination; information on mercury poisoning and antidotes; background information for biographies on Lothar Meyer, Johannes Thiele, and Edward W. Washburn; and notebooks from chemistry courses Benfey took at University College London and Columbia University.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
